name: Maggi et ux., Appellants, v. Flynn

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien and Pomeroy, JJ.
Mr. Justice Cohen and Mr. Justice Roberts took no part in consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Maggi et ux., Appellants, v. Flynn.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The appeal is quashed as interlocutory for the reasons enunciated in Stadler v. Mt. Oliver Borough, 373 Pa. 316, 95 A. 2d 776 (1953).
Mr. Justice Cohen and Mr. Justice Roberts took no part in consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Martin Meyer, with him Mack and Meyer, for appellants.
B. Todd Maguire, with him James P. Harris, Jr., for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Maggi et ux., Appellants, v. Flynn.
Argued November 18, 1970.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien and Pomeroy, JJ.
Martin Meyer, with him Mack and Meyer, for appellants.
B. Todd Maguire, with him James P. Harris, Jr., for appellees.
January 7, 1971:
